verses.kjv: Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!
verses.ct: Then Jesus told his disciples, "It's unavoidable that things will cause people to stumble into sin, but how terrible it will be for the person who causes it!

verses.kjv: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
verses.ct: It would be better for that person to have a heavy millstone tied around their neck and be thrown into the sea than to cause one of these little ones to stumble.

verses.kjv: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
verses.ct: Watch yourselves carefully. If your brother sins against you, confront him about it. And if he turns from his sin, forgive him.

verses.kjv: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt forgive him.
verses.ct: Even if he sins against you 7 times in a single day, and each time comes back to you saying, 'I'm turning from my sin,' you must forgive him."

verses.kjv: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
verses.ct: The apostles said to the Lord, "Give us greater faith!"

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.
verses.ct: The Lord replied, "If your faith were even as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, 'Uproot yourself and plant yourself in the sea,' and it would obey you.

verses.kjv: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?
verses.ct: Suppose one of you has a servant who has been out plowing or tending livestock. When the servant comes in from the field, would you immediately say, 'Come sit down and eat'?

verses.kjv: And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?
verses.ct: Of course not. Instead, you would say, 'Get my dinner ready, then get yourself prepared and serve me while I eat and drink. After that, you can have your meal.'

verses.kjv: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.
verses.ct: Do you thank the servant for doing what he was told to do? I don't think so.

verses.kjv: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
verses.ct: It's the same with you. When you've done everything you were instructed to do, say, 'We are ordinary servants who have simply done what was expected of us.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.ct: While Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem, he traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

verses.kjv: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:
verses.ct: As he was entering a certain village, 10 men with leprosy met him. They kept their distance

verses.kjv: And they lifted up their voices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
verses.ct: and called out loudly, "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!"

verses.kjv: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go shew yourselves unto the priests. And it came to pass, that, as they went, they were cleansed.
verses.ct: When he noticed them, he said, "Go and present yourselves to the priests." As they were on their way there, they were healed.

verses.kjv: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,
verses.ct: One of them, when he realized he had been healed, turned around and came back, praising God at the top of his voice.

verses.kjv: And fell down on his face at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
verses.ct: He threw himself facedown at Jesus' feet, thanking him over and over. This man was a Samaritan.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said, Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Weren't all 10 healed? Where are the other 9?

verses.kjv: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.
verses.ct: Was no one willing to come back and give glory to God except this foreigner?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.
verses.ct: Then he told the man, "Stand up and go on your way. Your faith has made you well."

verses.kjv: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
verses.ct: When the Pharisees asked Jesus when the kingdom of God would arrive, he answered them, "The kingdom of God doesn't come in ways you can observe with your eyes.

verses.kjv: Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
verses.ct: People won't say, 'Look, it's here!' or 'It's over there!' because the kingdom of God is already among you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
verses.ct: Then he said to his disciples, "A time is coming when you will long to see even one of the days of the Son of Man, but you won't experience it.

verses.kjv: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after them, nor follow them.
verses.ct: People will tell you, 'Look, he's here!' or 'He's over there!' Don't chase after them or follow them.

verses.kjv: For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day.
verses.ct: Because just as lightning flashes and lights up the entire sky from one horizon to the other, that is how the Son of Man will be on his day.

verses.kjv: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.
verses.ct: But first he must endure terrible suffering and be rejected by this generation.

verses.kjv: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.
verses.ct: Just as it was during the time of Noah, so it will be during the days of the Son of Man.

verses.kjv: They did eat, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
verses.ct: People were eating, drinking, getting married, and being given in marriage — right up until the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed every one of them.

verses.kjv: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot; they did eat, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded;
verses.ct: It was the same during the time of Lot. People were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, and building.

verses.kjv: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.
verses.ct: But on the very day Lot left Sodom, fire and burning sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed every one of them.

verses.kjv: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.
verses.ct: That is exactly how it will be on the day the Son of Man is revealed.

verses.kjv: In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back.
verses.ct: On that day, anyone on the rooftop must not go back inside to grab their belongings, and anyone out in the field must not turn back home.

verses.kjv: Remember Lot’s wife.
verses.ct: Remember what happened to Lot's wife.

verses.kjv: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.
verses.ct: Whoever tries to hold on to their life will lose it, and whoever lets go of their life will preserve it.

verses.kjv: I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, on that night 2 people will be in one bed — one will be taken and the other left behind.

verses.kjv: Two women shall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
verses.ct: 2 women will be grinding grain together — one will be taken and the other left behind.

verses.kjv: Two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.
verses.ct: 2 men will be working in the field — one will be taken and the other left behind."

verses.kjv: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body is, thither will the eagles be gathered together.
verses.ct: They asked him, "Where will this happen, Lord?" He replied, "Wherever the dead body is, that's where the vultures will gather."
